title: Quiz 5: Care of the Dying
description: Assess knowledge on Kubler-Ross stages, signs of death, and nursing responsibilities.

questions.question: Arrange the 5 stages of dying (Dr. Elisabeth Kubler Ross) in order:
questions.explanation: DABDA: Denial, Anger, Bargaining, Depression, Acceptance.

questions.question: Which of the following is defined as 'the deliberate ending of life of an individual suffering from an incurable condition'?
questions.explanation: Active euthanasia is the deliberate act to end life. Passive euthanasia is withholding life-saving measures.

questions.question: Which of the following are physical signs of approaching death? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Loss of motion/sensation in legs first

questions.explanation: Circulation fails (coolness), breathing changes (Cheyne-Stokes), muscles relax, and sensation is lost starting from legs.

questions.question: A 'Living Will' is a document describing a person's wishes concerning medical care when death is near.
questions.explanation: A living will guides family/doctors when the patient cannot participate in decision making.
questions.hint: It speaks for the patient while they are alive but incapacitated.

questions.question: What is the last sense to leave the body during the dying process?
questions.explanation: Hearing is believed to be the last sense to remain, so one should always speak kindly to the patient.

questions.question: Match the term with its definition in terminal care:

pairs.right: Care focused on dignity/support for dying
Grieving before the actual loss occurs

questions.explanation: Hospice is a philosophy of care; Denial is a stage; Anticipatory grief happens beforehand; Autopsy is a medical exam after death.
questions.hint: Match the concept to the description.

questions.question: Who is legally responsible for pronouncing the patient dead?
questions.explanation: By law, a doctor is the one to pronounce the patient dead.

questions.question: When performing last offices (care after death), you should remove dentures immediately to prevent them from getting lost.
questions.explanation: Dentures should usually be put IN to maintain the shape of the face before rigor mortis sets in (unless hospital policy states otherwise).
questions.hint: Think about the appearance of the face.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ order means that if cardiac or respiratory arrest occurs, no resuscitation measures should be initiated.
questions.explanation: DNR stands for Do Not Resuscitate.

questions.question: How should a wedding ring be handled during last offices if it cannot be removed?
questions.explanation: It should be secured with adhesive tape so it does not slip off and get lost, and the fact noted in the records.
